titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John R. St. Felix papers 1977.172
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.abstract: The John R. St. Felix papers span the period 1821 to 1864 and include correspondence, receipts, contracts for home construction and repairs, land conveyances for properties in Brooklyn, and other legal and business papers.
did.langmaterial: Materials primarily in English. A few pieces of correspondence are written in French.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: John R. St. Felix was a Brooklyn resident and is listed as a New York City import merchant in an 1845 residential directory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John R. St. Felix papers span the period 1821 to 1864 and measure 0.1 linear feet. The papers include correspondence, receipts, contracts for home construction and repairs, land conveyances for properties in Brooklyn, and other legal and business papers.
